intro: Quercus shennongii, commonly known as the Shennong mountain oak, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It is a deciduous tree characterized by its deeply lobed leaves and acorns that are typically enclosed in a cupule. The plant belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, chestnuts, and beeches. It thrives in mountainous regions with high altitude and cool climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
